ratings.comment: Easiest class I have ever taken in life. Professor refuses to give anything lower than a B, even if you literally fail every exam.

An easy physical science class. Class rarely lasts more than 20 minutes. Short and easy term paper, easy tests with cheat sheets. Everything on the exam comes from class except a few random facts (be prepared for the most illegible handwriting you've ever seen on the board). If you can plug numbers into formulas, you will get an A in the class.

This class is a complete joke and waste of time. Prof Ogelman is really nice, funny guy, but you won't learn anything. Goes at a snail's pace and teaches the most elementary material. My third grade science class was more difficult. If you only care about getting an A without exerting any effort, then this is the class for you. If not, is torture.

Prof. Ogelman is a wonderful guy- really funny, willing to end class after 15 minutes (or less) and attendance is anything but mandatory. That being said, I didn't learn a thing about physics, and I managed to get an A..He doesn't give out a lot of those, but he won't give less than a B. If you stink at math like me, this class is great
Biggest joke of a class.  If you want an easy A, take this class.
Great guy, really funny, but I consistantly left his class wondering what the hell he said, without fail.  Take this class!! It was so easy!

If you want a B or above, definitely take this class.  He doesn't give below a B.  If you're looking for an easy A, then you may have found your class too.  There's no final, you get to use a cheat sheet on both of your midterms and you write a paper on whatever topic in physics you want. For me, you could give me the book and I wouldn't get it.
The most generous and caring professor I have had here at Madison so far! Puts students first. Class is enjoyable and easy to follow. A great way to satisfy your quant b requirement.
Really easy class.  stroke victim so he is tough to understand.  Good guy though
